titles.title: Representative Payee Amendments of 1993
A bill to amend the Social Security Act to extend for 3 years the provision for compensation of qualified organizations serving as representative payees, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S16725)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

term.name: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

bill.summary: 11/20/1993--Introduced. Representative Payee Amendments of 1993 - Amends titles II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) (OASDI) and XVI (Supplemental Security Income) (SSI) of the Social Security Act to extend provisions allowing qualified organizations to collect fees for serving as representative payees for OASDI and SSI beneficiaries. Expands the eligibility of organizations qualified to serve as representative payees by repealing the requirement that they were in existence on October 1, 1988.
